subject: Doping (Sports)
lead_paragraph: Operation Puerto, cycling’s biggest doping investigation, has ended without a conviction. The Spanish news media reported that a judge officially sealed Operation Puerto, which had implicated more than 50 riders. Raids in Madrid and Zaragoza in May 2006 turned up steroids, hormones and the endurance-boosting substance EPO, nearly 100 bags of frozen blood and equipment for treating blood. Judge Antonio Serrano reportedly decided to close the case after tested samples showed levels of EPO that were too low to merit a health risk — in line with Spanish doping laws then. U.C.I., cycling’s governing body, is trying to see the evidence gathered in the investigation.
